record.dc:title: 13BY11 Rymer, Bradley County, Tennessee. Burials 15BY21 and 15BY23. Burial 21, the uppermost is an infant; Burial 23, a senile male lies beneath. Skull of the latter was displaced by interment of infant. Square 20R5. Direction NW.
record.wpa:narrative: [15BY21] Indeterminate infant in fair condition, partly flexed on back with head to SW. Four very fragmentary strips of rotten wood extended under the skeleton. At least two of these extended the entire length of the grave, over 15BY23. [15BY23] Adult female in good condition, extended on back with head to NE. 15BY18 and 15BY21 occupied approximately the same levels in the top of the pit; one in each end. 15BY21 was probably the original occupant. Strips of rotten wood 0.5' above 15BY23 (See burial 15BY21).
